title: FLSP to file legal action over Colombo Dockyard stake sale - Dy Minister assures transparency
byline: The Front Line Socialist Party (FLSP) has announced plans to take legal action against the government’s decision to hand over a stake in Colombo Dockyard to a foreign entity.

title: Snow cloaks Atacama, the world’s driest desert
byline: Residents of the world’s driest desert, the Atacama in northern Chile, woke up Thursday to a jaw-dropping spectacle: its famous lunar landscape blanketed in snow.

title: US must rule out more strikes before new talks, Iranian minister
byline: The US must rule out any further strikes on Iran if it wants to resume diplomatic talks, Tehran’s deputy foreign minister has told the BBC.

title: Israel orders evacuations in northern Gaza as Trump pushes for ceasefire
byline: Israel has ordered Palestinians to evacuate from parts of northern Gaza ahead of increased military action, as US President Donald Trump pushes for a ceasefire deal.

title: SL lacks reform momentum despite political shift: Top economist
byline: Sri Lanka is falling short of delivering the structural transformation it claims to seek, despite the growing rhetoric around revival and sustainable growth, warned internationally renowned economist Prof. Razeen Sally.

title: Budgetary Relief Allowance Amendment Bill too inconsistent with Constitution
byline: The Supreme Court held that the Budget Relief Allowance Amendment Bill is inconsistent with Article 12(1) of the Constitution and could be approved by a special majority in Parliament, Deputy Speaker Rizvie Salih informed Parliament today.

title: SC holds some clauses of Electricity Amendment Bill inconsistent with Constitution
byline: The Supreme Court (SC) held that some clauses of the Electricity Amendment Bill are inconsistent with the Constitution and could be approved by a special majority in Parliament while it has to be endorsed by the people at a referendum, Deputy Speaker Rizvie Salih announced today.

title: Five police OICs transferred with immediate effect
byline: Five Officers-in-Charge (OICs) of police stations across the country have been transferred with immediate effect, following the approval of the National Police Commission.

title: CSD officer named Anura Kumara Disanayake trampled to death by wild elephant
byline: A Civil Security Constable attached to the Wilpattu Civil Security Department camp, named D. M. Anura Kumara Disanayake (47) was trampled to death by a wild elephant in the Pemaduwa area under the Mahawilachchiya police division on Sunday (29).

title: Sharp rise in reports of child abuse in Eastern Province, over 300 cases recorded
byline: A significant surge in child abuse cases involving children under the age of 16 has been reported  from the Eastern Province with 304 incidents being recorded in 2024, Senior DIG Waruna Jayasundara pointed out.

title: “Podi Zaharan’’ arrested for filming Dawoodi Bohra Convention in Colombo
byline: A 27-year-old Mohamed Shafrool, alias “Podi Zaharan, was arrested by police for allegedly filming the Dawoodi Bohra community’s spiritual convention currently being held in Bambalapitiya, Colombo, Police said.

title: Indictments served on Lakshman Yapa over alleged misuse of BOI funds
byline: The Colombo High Court today served indictments on former Minister Lakshman Yapa Abeywardena and former Director General of the Board of Investment (BOI), Jayanta Edirisinghe, over the alleged misuse of BOI funds in 2014.

title: Six couples in Meegoda officially tie knots in community wedding ceremony
byline: Six unmarried couples from Hettiyawatta, Meegoda, who had been living together as family units with their children for many years, officially entered into legal marriage in a special community wedding ceremony held recently.

title: New Police Media Spokesman appointed
byline: Assistant Superintendent of Police (ASP) F.U. Wootler has been appointed as the new Media Spokesman for the Sri Lanka Police with effect from today, Police Headquarters said.

title: More skeletal remains, personal belongings unearthed at Chemmani mass grave
byline: The ongoing excavation at the Chemmani mass grave site in Jaffna has led to the discovery of several more human skeletal remains along with personal belongings, marking a significant development in the investigation.

title: Imported Malaria case detected in Kurunegala
byline: A 26-year-old man who recently returned to Sri Lanka from Tanzania has been diagnosed with Malaria and is currently receiving treatment at the Kurunegala Teaching Hospital, health officials confirmed.

title: NPP members in Norwood PS break away over chairman resignation dispute
byline: All six members of the National People’s Power (NPP) representing the Norwood Pradeshiya Sabha have announced their decision to serve as independent members, protesting the party’s demand that newly elected Chairman John Francis Allen resign from his post.

title: Sri Lankan passenger nabbed smuggling Rs. 60 mn in electronics at BIA
byline: A Sri Lankan passenger attempting to smuggle a stock of high-end electronic devices valued at over Rs. 60 million was arrested by airport customs officers at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) early this morning.

title: Government announces ambitious plan to reduce debt to 95% of GDP by 2032: MP
byline: The government hopes to reduce the country’s debt services to 95 percent of the GDP by 2032, and further lower it to 60 percent thereafter, MP Kaushalya Ariyaratne told Parliament today.

title: Arjun Aloysius, two others charged over Rs. 1 billion VAT fraud
byline: The Department of Inland Revenue filed legal action before Colombo Additional Magistrate Pavithra Sanjeewani Pathirana against Arjun Aloysius, Anthony Randev and Jinendra John, directors of Mendis Company, over allegations of evading the payment of Value Added Tax (VAT) amounting to over Rs. 1 billion due to the government.

title: Sri Lanka, Malaysia bolster leisure travel partnership
byline: Strengthening tourism ties between the two nations, Tourism Malaysia and SriLankan Airlines have embarked on a joint promotion drive aimed at increasing leisure travel between Sri Lanka and Malaysia, with both countries eager to showcase their diverse attractions to each other’s travellers.

title: Fake job scam on YouTube, Facebook: SLBFE alerts
byline: The Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment (SLBFE) says it has received information about a fake foreign job scam being run through social media platforms like YouTube and Facebook.

title: Egg production at risk despite lower market prices: Producers
byline: Even though consumers are currently benefiting from reduced egg prices, the All Island Egg Producers Association (AIEPA) has raised concerns that the country’s egg production sector is under serious threat.

title: Malwathu Maha Viharaya denies claims of intervention request by Mahinda Rajapaksa
byline: The Malwathu Maha Viharaya in Kandy has denied claims circulating on social media that former President Mahinda Rajapaksa sought the temple’s intervention to prevent the arrest of former First Lady Shiranthi Rajapaksa.

title: ASPI crosses 18,000 mark
byline: The Colombo bourse saw the All Share Price Index (ASPI) cross the 18,000 milestone for the first time in history today.

title: Lorry carrying explosives seized on Habarana-Trincomalee Road
byline: Police have seized a lorry transporting explosives along the Habarana-Trincomalee main road.

title: Immigration unearths major boarding card swap scam to send Lankan men to UK for asylum
byline: In a rare detection, the Department of Immigration and Emigration (DIE) officials at the airport yesterday arrested a Mullaitivu resident bound for Mumbai and uncovered a sophisticated scam of exchanging their boarding passes to go to the UK and allegedly to claim asylum afterwards.

title: Fuel prices increased from tonight
byline: The Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (Ceypetco) has announced a revision of fuel prices, which will come into effect from midnight today (30).

title: Former Minister Gamini Lokuge passes away
byline: Former Minister Gamini Lokuge passed away in a private hospital this evening.

title: Not much progress despite scores of lives lost annually: Specialist
byline: The Multisectoral Strategic Action Plan on Injury Prevention and Management, a mechanism introduced in 2021 to minimise accidents, is yet to see tangible progress despite scores of lives being lost, a specialist said.

title: ’Have faced many fears, challenges in life’: Cardinal Malcolm Ranjith
byline: Archbishop of Colombo, Cardinal Malcolm Ranjith, who marked 50 years of religious life today, reflected on his spiritual journey, acknowledging the many fears and challenges he has faced over the decades.

title: Indian team in Washington extends stay for trade talks
byline: Officials from India will extend their Washington visit to try to reach agreement on a trade deal with U.S. President Donald Trump’s administration and address lingering concerns on both sides, two Indian government sources said on Monday.

title: Dengue breeding sites: Over 140 face legal action
byline: Legal action was taken against 143 individuals for maintaining environments conducive to mosquito breeding, the National Dengue Control Unit said, marking the launch of National Mosquito Control Week.

title: Traders face Rs. 5Mn fine for overpricing rice
byline: A fine of up to Rs. 5 million will be imposed on traders selling rice above the government’s gazetted maximum retail price, the Consumer Affairs Authority (CAA) warned.

title: Sajith warns of Parate Law impact, urges protection for MSMEs
byline: Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa has called on the government to urgently introduce sustainable solutions to support micro, small, and medium-scale entrepreneurs, warning that many in the sector are in distress and confusion.

title: Sri Lanka the only Asian nation in talks with US on tariffs: Minister
byline: Sri Lanka is the only country in the Asia region currently engaged in discussions with U.S. officials to renegotiate tariffs imposed under former U.S. President Donald Trump’s administration, Deputy Minister of Economic Development Prof. Anil Jayantha Fernando told Parliament today (30).

title: Archuna spreads false information in Parliament based on AI-generated images
byline: Member of Parliament Archuna Ramanathan has reportedly conveyed false information to Parliament based on an AI-generated model of a skeleton.

title: Handunetti’s presentation at World Economic Forum not an issue: Opposition MP
byline: The shortcomings pertaining to Minister Sunil Handunetti’s language skills in his presentation at the World Economic Forum is not an issue, Opposition MP S.M. Marikar told Parliament today.

title: MP Shanakiyan concerned over handling of Chemmmani mass grave
byline: Batticaloa District MP Shanakiyan Rasamanickam has voiced serious concerns over the ongoing exhumations at the Chemmmani mass grave site in Jaffna questioning the transparency and security of the process.

title: Court orders swift probe into misuse of “Million for Ishaq” fundraiser
byline: The Mulleriyawa Police informed Colombo Additional Magistrate Kasun Kanchana Dissanayake today that an investigation has been launched into individuals suspected of misusing the ’’Million for Ishaq’’ fundraising campaign initiated to support ailing veteran artist Ishaq Baig to fraudulently collect money from foreign nationals.

title: CSE closes June quarter with ASPI surpassing 18,000 mark
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) closed the month on a historic high, with the All Share Price Index (ASPI) surpassing the 18,000 mark for the first time. This achievement reflects a continued wave of investor optimism and strong market momentum, supported by active participation across multiple sectors.

title: Govt launches concessionary loan scheme for paddy millers
byline: The Ministry of Finance has launched a Rs. 6.5 billion concessionary loan scheme for SME paddy millers and cooperative societies to purchase paddy during the 2025 Yala season, from July 1 to November 15.

title: MS Dhoni files for trademark of iconic nickname ’Captain Cool’
byline: Mahendra Singh Dhoni has filed a trademark application for ‘Captain Cool’, a name that fans have lovingly used for years to describe his ice-cool style of leadership.

title: Handunneththi says remarks at China Forum misrepresented
byline: Minister of Industry and Entrepreneurship Development, Sunil Handunneththi told Parliament today that his recent speech at the World Economic Forum in China had been misrepresented by some individuals to suit their personal agendas.
